result.markdown:
---
title: "Regression Discontinuity"
---


# Load packages

::: {.cell hash='10_rdd_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_1a9725cede7bb0f48b38e2540d29627f'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(dagitty)
library(ggdag)
library(MatchIt)
library(estimatr)
library(rddensity)
```
:::

# Load data

::: {.cell hash='10_rdd_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_8339b031b9d8e03278b8a0dba3571248'}

```{.r .cell-code}
setwd("D:/CausalDataScience/cdsba-LukasB2324/content/01_journal")
df<-readRDS("Data/coupon.rds")
```
:::




# Assignment 1

::: {.cell hash='10_rdd_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_b992789b6f7bec64f7a2136b6c53df27'}

```{.r .cell-code}
c0 <- 60
bw <- c0 + c(-5/2, 5/2) # half the bandwidth

df_bw_below <- df %>% filter(days_since_last >= bw[1] & days_since_last < c0)
df_bw_above <- df %>% filter(days_since_last >= c0 & days_since_last <= bw[2])

df_bw <- bind_rows(df_bw_above, df_bw_below)
dim(df_bw)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1] 181   4
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
model_bw_below <- lm(purchase_after ~ days_since_last, df_bw_below)
model_bw_above <- lm(purchase_after ~ days_since_last, df_bw_above)

y0 <- predict(model_bw_below, tibble(days_since_last = c0))
y1 <- predict(model_bw_above, tibble(days_since_last = c0))

late <- y1 - y0
sprintf("LATE with half the bandwidth: %.2f", late)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1] "LATE with half the bandwidth: 7.36"
```
:::
:::




# Assignment 2

::: {.cell hash='10_rdd_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_121667dbe32765e561ada05f6d2e8ec9'}

```{.r .cell-code}
c0 <- 60
bw <- c0 + c(-5*2, 5*2) # double the bandwidth

df_bw_below <- df %>% filter(days_since_last >= bw[1] & days_since_last < c0)
df_bw_above <- df %>% filter(days_since_last >= c0 & days_since_last <= bw[2])

df_bw <- bind_rows(df_bw_above, df_bw_below)
dim(df_bw)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1] 629   4
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
model_bw_below <- lm(purchase_after ~ days_since_last, df_bw_below)
model_bw_above <- lm(purchase_after ~ days_since_last, df_bw_above)

y0 <- predict(model_bw_below, tibble(days_since_last = c0))
y1 <- predict(model_bw_above, tibble(days_since_last = c0))

late <- y1 - y0
sprintf("LATE with double the bandwidth: %.2f", late)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1] "LATE with double the bandwidth: 9.51"
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
sprintf("Changing the bandwidth has a noticable influence on the LATE. Especially doubling the bandwidth increases the LATE a lot.")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1] "Changing the bandwidth has a noticable influence on the LATE. Especially doubling the bandwidth increases the LATE a lot."
```
:::
:::


# Assignment 3

::: {.cell hash='10_rdd_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_cf4d8618ede208d359e05fd2ed6b80ea'}

```{.r .cell-code}
shipping_data<-readRDS("Data/shipping.rds")
c0=30
rddd <- rddensity(shipping_data$purchase_amount, c = c0)
summary(rddd)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> 
#> Manipulation testing using local polynomial density estimation.
#> 
#> Number of obs =       6666
#> Model =               unrestricted
#> Kernel =              triangular
#> BW method =           estimated
#> VCE method =          jackknife
#> 
#> c = 30                Left of c           Right of c          
#> Number of obs         3088                3578                
#> Eff. Number of obs    2221                1955                
#> Order est. (p)        2                   2                   
#> Order bias (q)        3                   3                   
#> BW est. (h)           22.909              20.394              
#> 
#> Method                T                   P > |T|             
#> Robust                5.9855              0
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
#> Warning in summary.CJMrddensity(rddd): There are repeated observations. Point
#> estimates and standard errors have been adjusted. Use option massPoints=FALSE
#> to suppress this feature.
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> 
#> P-values of binomial tests (H0: p=0.5).
#> 
#> Window Length / 2          <c     >=c    P>|T|
#> 0.261                      20      26    0.4614
#> 0.522                      41      65    0.0250
#> 0.783                      62     107    0.0007
#> 1.043                      81     136    0.0002
#> 1.304                     100     169    0.0000
#> 1.565                     114     196    0.0000
#> 1.826                     132     227    0.0000
#> 2.087                     156     263    0.0000
#> 2.348                     173     298    0.0000
#> 2.609                     191     331    0.0000
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
rdd_plot <- rdplotdensity(rddd, shipping_data$purchase_amount, plotN = 1000, xlabel="purchase_amount", ylabel="density")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](10_rdd_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

No, the data of 'purchase_amount' is not suited as a running variable with a cut-off at 30€, because the plot shows a sudden large jump at 30€. As can be seen in the plot, the confidence intervals do not overlap.
